pullRequest.body:
This PR shows that metric spaces are T6. It also generalizes the contents of Mathlib/Topology/GDelta/UniformSpace to apply to metrizable spaces.

See this [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60IsClosed.2EisG.CE.B4.60) thread.

---

I want this to be a `simp` lemma. Can you add it near [Set.Iic_disjoint_Ioi](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Interval/Set/Disjoint.html#Set.Iic_disjoint_Ioi) please?

A few notes:

1. the `sorry` can be filled by the suggested `simp` lemma, once you add that.
2. For the `fun_prop` to work, you need to mark `continuous_infDist_pt` with that attribute.
3. there's no reason to inline the instance here, this is just a proof, so we use `let _` instead of `letI`.
4. it's easier to use the definition of `separatedNhds` directly here, instead of going through the `nhdsSet` filter, because you're constructing open sets.

```suggestion
    let _ := pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric
    by_cases hee : s = ∅ ∨ t = ∅
    · obtain rfl | rfl := hee <;> simp
    simp only [not_or, ← ne_eq, ← nonempty_iff_ne_empty] at hee
    obtain ⟨hse, hte⟩ := hee
    let g (p : X) := infDist p t - infDist p s
    have hg : Continuous g := by fun_prop
    refine ⟨g ⁻¹' (Ioi 0), g ⁻¹' (Iio 0), isOpen_Ioi.preimage hg, isOpen_Iio.preimage hg,
      fun x hx ↦ ?_, fun x hx ↦ ?_, Disjoint.preimage _ (by sorry)⟩
    · simp [g, infDist_zero_of_mem hx,
        (ht.not_mem_iff_infDist_pos hte).mp (hst.not_mem_of_mem_left hx)]
    · simp [g, infDist_zero_of_mem hx,
        (hs.not_mem_iff_infDist_pos hse).mp (hst.not_mem_of_mem_right hx)]
```

I used `letI` because the docstring for `PseudoMetrizableSpace` says "To endow such a space with a compatible distance, use `letI : PseudoMetricSpace X := TopologicalSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric X`"

Some notes:

1. Again, no reason to inline the instance.
2. It's nice to use dedicated lemmas like `Set.eq_empty_or_nonempty` to do case splitting because then you don't have to use rewrites to put the negated case in the right form.
3. It's much easier to use an indexed union instead of a set union to show that this set `IsGδ`.
4. Try to avoid reproving the archimedean property from scratch and just use `exists_nat_one_div_lt`.

```suggestion
    let _ := pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric
    obtain rfl | he := s.eq_empty_or_nonempty
    · exact IsGδ.empty
    convert IsGδ.iInter_of_isOpen
      fun n : ℕ ↦ isOpen_Iio (a := (n + 1 : ℝ)⁻¹).preimage (continuous_infDist_pt s)
    apply subset_antisymm
    · refine subset_iInter fun n x hx ↦ ?_
      simp only [mem_preimage, infDist_zero_of_mem hx, mem_Iio, inv_pos]
      positivity
    · intro x hx
      rw [hs.mem_iff_infDist_zero he]
      refine le_antisymm (le_of_forall_pos_lt_add fun ε hε ↦ ?_) infDist_nonneg
      obtain ⟨n, hn⟩ := exists_nat_one_div_lt hε
      exact (mem_iInter.mp hx n).trans <| by simpa using hn
```

```suggestion
  let _ := pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric
```
This shouldn't be marked `simp`, likewise for the other `a ≤ b` version below. (You could make a `DenselyOrdered` version that is an `iff` if you wanted.)

This *should* be marked `@[simp]`, but also the name should be `same`, not `self`, to match the theorems above.

(likewise for the other `self` lemma below)
Do these instances speed up or slow down the search?
Can these 2 instances be moved earlier in the import graph?
I see that the new proof is longer than the old one. Why doesn't the old one work?
